availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jasper Beagle (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier (11th KY Cav USA))

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Grant County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Beagle and Elizabeth Beagle. Resident of Grant County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attended school in Grant County in 1860. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from August 16, 1862 to July 10, 1865. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 22, 1862 to January 8, 1863. Reported as deserted in order to join the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) on January 8, 1863. Reported as wounded in Nashville, Tennessee, in August 1863. Served in the 16th Kentucky Veteran Reserve Corp as a private from April 1864 to August 1864.

ab.bibl:
